name: The Leela Palace New Delhi

reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights at the Leela Palace in Delhi and I can safely say this is the best hotel I have been to in India. I travel there every year for work/vacation and have stayed at the Oberoi/Taj/Imperial and this is definitely a step above. I arrive at 200 am and they completed check in at my room so I could get more sleep. Breakfast the following morning was a great spread of both Indian and Western food. Had dinner at Jamavaar which was also excellent though the menu could be more varied. The room was gorgeous- very modern and well appointed but at the same time very traditionally Indian. Bathoom was beautiful marble with a huge sink in tub that had rose petals and a TV to watch while you bathe! What however set the hotel apart was the service from the staff. Nothing was too much to do from a specific coffee to running to the pharmacy to get medicine I had left at home (this was done at no additional charge). The spa is also not to be missed with excellent service. All in all this is the place to stay in Delhi.
reviews.title: Absolutely outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The experience of staying in this hotel was far beyond expectations. We booked this hotel on our honeymoon to India as a treat in New Delhi. We stayed here 4 nights and from the welcome to the check out evrything was amazing. The staff is very helpful, the amenities such as the gym are outstanding and our room was surprisingly spacious and well decorated. The restaurant is also great except that we were not that impressed with the breakfast buffet. Staying in this hotel does make you feel like royalty!
reviews.title: Amazing Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 2 weeks in India in January 2012. It was our first visit, and we stayed at the following hotels in order: Leela Palace (Delhi), Raas Haveli (Jodhpur), The Serai (near Jaisalmer), Oberia Udaivilas (Udaipur), and Imperial Hotel (Delhi). The Leela Palace was our 2nd favorite stop, behind The Serai.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Friendly - Highly Recommended

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Leela Palace and had an excellent experience. There are many hotels claiming to be top-flight in Delhi but I can't imagine they are better than this (the Imperial certainly is far far far off - see my review). We stayed in a club-floor room, which I would highly recommend since you can stop in for snacks, drinks and great service at your leisure.
reviews.title: Palacial

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the establishment is relatively new and beautifully decorated. The lobby is magical. There are flowers all over the interior are huge, stunning arrangements. You could spend a couple of hours just wandering around the property enjoying the decor.
reviews.title: Creme de la Creme of Hotels

reviews.text: I had an amazing experience in this property. The spa service, food, decor everything is perfect. Perfect attention is given to the smallest detail which makes it an ideal hotel. It is like staying in a palace (price wise as well);)
reviews.title: Suits perfectly with the name

reviews.text: We stayed recently, the perfect pla ce in Delhi to stay with family, the grandeur the class was superb. The people are little snobbish but they work with pride. The restaurants are little expensive but worth money spent.
reviews.title: Amazingly beautiful!!!

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at the Leela Palace in the Royal Premier Room.
reviews.title: Brand New and Excellent Interiors Design and First Class Service....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was received and greeted by the Hotel Staff after Passport Control and escorted to a Brand New BMW 7series to take me to the hotel which as you can imagine for India it is like Royalty...
reviews.title: BIGGEST DISAPPOINTMENT ... ALL PRETENSE ... BOTTOM LINE ... AN EMBARRASSMENT!

reviews.text: Upon arriving to the hotel entrance i was greeted by a hotel lady which welcomed me and had the flowers on my neck and then escorted straight to my room for check in.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!
You must experience this if staying in Deli
reviews.text: Beautiful new hotel, flawless service, infinity pool on the roof over looking Deli, rooms are perfect and staff went out of their way to assist us in every way. If you want an experience, this would certainly be worth a try (for even one night) and we would definitely go again.

One of the most recent properties of Leela and rightfully the best in NCR..... We had a very big gathering for almost 7 days and also an event one evening, with more than 200 people at the Grand Ballroom. Each and every aspect of the hotel stay was perfect. The rooms are excellent and the food in the restaurants is just so good. Surely, they have sent new standards for service and luxury..
reviews.title: Luxury redifined !!!

reviews.text: What can I say ........ new hotel, great rooms, great food, great service! A very good General Manager who actually listens to his customers. The bathrooms are one of the best I've seen. Great Leela standards.
reviews.title: Truly a great hotel!

reviews.text: A must stay!
reviews.title: a real palace

reviews.text: The staff of the hotel is what it should be proud of. We even had an experince of arranging a small wedding ceremony there - and for that we were specially offered a room. The heated roof top pool is like from haven. Food in the Qube is tasty during lunch and they have a european chef. But only the Qube is working for the lunch time. The other restaurants are only open for dinners, but you are not allowed ther with children. The location is just nearby the jewellery village Jashvant Place. Around 15 minutes from airport at night and 40 minutes in the busy hours.
reviews.title: Stay at The Leela Palace

reviews.text: it is really a nice hotel to stay.. had stayed for 4 nights and indeed a wonderful experience throughout.. the breakfast buffet was good.. and so were the services with freindly staffs. thowever the location was quite a problem to us but still we managed ..
reviews.title: good and reasonable

reviews.text: On entry to The Leela, the staff were extremely helpful and attentive, and this remained throughout the stay. The room was stunning, and all of the amenities one would expect from a 5* hotel were present. The i-remote system in the room was particularly brilliant (something I have never seen before!), and was topped only by the wild mushroom risotto from the room service menu! We were a little disappointed by the standard of breakfast, however. Although a reasonably varied choice, the bread and cheese were left for self-cutting, which didn't seem to be a particularly hygienic option, and the servers were all frantically run off their feet and forgot to bring tea and new cutlery several times throughout the meal. For the most part, the hotel is luxurious and calming in the bustle of Delhi and is of very good value.
reviews.title: A luxurious haven in Delhi!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Leela in late June. I was on my 4th trip to India and this was my first stay at the Leela. I stayed there for 5 nights at the beginning of the trip and 2 nights at the end of the trip. In between, we stayed in the Taj palaces (Rambagh and Umaid Bhawan) in Jaipur and Jodhpur. As lovely as the palaces were, I was looking forward to returning to the Leela because it is more convenient and hospitable to the business traveler. Perfection, ever detail, every person on staff. Rooms are beautifully decorated, very clean. Food is excellent. Rooftop pool is divine for morning swimming. Gym is the best I've seen in India. Staff is amazing. On arrival, British Airways had lost my luggage and the Concierge persistently called the airline until it was delivered the next morning. The night prior to my travel back to New York, I was very sick my last night at the hotel, almost feeling so bad that I didn't think I could manage the flight. The concierge ran asked for my symptoms and in the wee morning hours, ran to the Pharmacy to get me medicine. I have had experiences staying at the Oberoi, Shangri-La, The Grand and the Westin. None can compare. Hats off to the staff, you made a hot and challenging trip delightful.
reviews.title: Best Business Hotel in Delhi

reviews.text: This is one remarkable hotel at New Delhi. One of the most expensive too. The hotel itself is not so big (I would categorize it under boutique if I can), but as whole a fantastic experience.I was there for business ( few days in September 2011) , the room is lovely, the washroom is mind blowing. I like the small LCD screen on the mirror. The service is awesome. Downsides are their charge for rental cars. I use the same care ( BMW X5) at Hyatt Regency Delhi at 30% less price and their loyalty points ( doesn't make sense to collect them as outside India they don't have much presence). That's the reason I avoided them for my last two visit at Delhi and stayed at Hyatt instead.
reviews.title: My stay at Leela Palace , 2011

reviews.text: One of the most recent properties and rightfully the best in NCR..... We had a very big gathering for almost 2 days and also an event one evening. Each and every aspect of the hotel stay was perfect. The rooms are excellent and the food in the restaurants is just so good. Surely, they have sent new standards for service and luxury. It was a remarkable experience and I recommend it to all those who a re looking for a perfect stay in Gurgaon . I must say we were equally impressed by both the initial luxury and the quality of food & beverages.
reviews.title: " Luxury Redefined "

aka: The Leela Palace New Delhi Hotel
description: The Leela Palace New Delhi at Chanakyapuri is located in the exclusive Diplomatic Enclave and has room sizes starting from 550 Sq ft. The hotel is close to the seat of government and houses four restaurants including two New York imports, Le Cirque and MEGU, two bars and a multilevel spa by ESPA, along with New Delhi's only temperature-controlled rooftop swimming pool. The hotel offers complimentary broadband access of 10 mbps for its club guests along with breakfast and five food & beverage presentations at the lounge and round trip airport transfers by a BMW 5 or 7 series car.
